intro: Asperula cynanchica subvar. montana, commonly known as mountain asperula, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, arching stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often blooming in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. This species is well adapted to rocky and woodland soils, thriving in partial shade to full sun.
